summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff discussing the production of documents, including Jeffrey Epstein's medical records, to The New York Times in the case Times v. BOP. The discussion centers on what medical records can be disclosed, specifically those related to a 'July 23 incident' and Epstein's suicidality, versus other unrelated medical conditions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical records being discussed for production. His records, particularly those related to a July 23 incident and suicidality, are the focus of the email chain.

events.title: Email discussion on document production
events.description: USANYS staff correspond about finalizing and reviewing a document production for The New York Times in the case Times v. BOP, which includes Jeffrey Epstein's medical records.

events.title: July 23 incident involving Epstein
events.description: Referenced incident involving Jeffrey Epstein while in BOP custody. The emails specify that some medical records are directly related to this incident.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing to produce documents, including Jeffrey Epstein's medical records, to The New York Times in response to a lawsuit (Times v. BOP).
There was internal debate about whether to disclose all of Epstein's medical records or only those related to suicidality and the 'July 23 incident'.
The 'July 23 incident' is noted as a specific event of concern directly connected to Epstein's medical records.
The email chain indicates coordination between the Criminal Division teams and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) regarding the redaction and release of these sensitive records.
